column4: ummm.  unlikely.   Unless you've /told/ it to slow your connection down!
it's normally the latter.  Do you have any specific example you can test with?
Hmm...well, none that aren't subjective :/ Like I can't ask people to check their ping to a certain Doom3 server, because everyone's is going to be different
this is probaby likely to do with more people using them
That's what I thought as well, initially, so I booted into Windows to check...on the same server list the pings were consistently lower, sometimes by up to 50ms
nod.  What do the command line 'ping' programs give you under linux/windows to that server?
how are you connecting to the internet?
modem, dsl, cable-modem, wifi?
Sorry for the delay, I'm connected to the Internet via cable modem...ping packets are blocked, though, so I can't actually use a normal ping program to test it :>
can you apt-get install  echoping  and use something like  echoping -u your.quake.server
Hmm...sure, I could try that :>
-d your.quake.server

it has various non-ICMP ways of doing pings.  Remember that if you're doing traceroutes, answering your traceroute packet is the last thing on an internet router's mind, as it has better things to do (like routeing packets)
cat you  cat /proc/interrupts  onto #flood
good ping times?
They've improved by about 60ms on average, definitely a big surprise

groovy, now lets try not to loose the workaround for your machine, can you  file a bug on  bugzilla.ubuntu.com  saying that you have ping problems and solves it by enbling  noapic  and also post the output of  dmidecode   (you might need to apt-get install dmidecode first).  Set the email address to  ubuntu@paul.sladen.org
Hmm...that's quite a good idea actually, I'll write a note to myself and do that as soon as possible
I personally use xine
There's a xine browser plugin? :>

I don't know if you're around at the moment, but just in case :> I'm pinging a machine on the same hub as me to make sure that there's no longer any bandwidth problems, I'm getting an average about 0.450ms for a reply...is that a fairly good rate?
